evs.metric.results
Class MetricResult

java.lang.Object
  evs.metric.results.MetricResult
Direct Known Subclasses:
DoubleMatrix1DResult, DoubleMatrix2DResult, DoubleResult, IntegerMatrix1DResult, IntegerResult, MetricResultStore
public abstract class MetricResult
extends java.lang.Object

The result of a metric calculation. Depending on the type of result returned by a metric, appropriate subclasses should be defined.

Version:
4.0
Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

aggregate

public abstract MetricResult aggregate(MetricResult[] input,
                                       VectorFunction func,
                                       double[] weights)
                                throws MetricResultException
Applies an aggregation function to the corresponding values (e.g. same matrix position) in the input results, placing a Metric.NULL_DATA if all of those values are Metric.NULL_DATA. Throws an exception if the inputs are not of the same class. The return type may not correspond to the input type if the result of the aggregation function cannot be stored in the input type. Specifically, any aggregation of a result that contains integers should ALWAYS return a result that contains doubles, as the aggregation function is guaranteed to do so. For example, the average of a set of integers may not be an integer. Specify a set of weights for each metric that are constant across all forecast lead times. The weights must sum to 1. No sampling intervals should be aggregated. Sampling uncertainty should be assessed on the aggregate quantities, rather than the sampling intervals aggregated.

Parameters:
input - the input results
func - the aggregation function
weights - the constant weights to apply across all lead times
Returns:
the aggregated result
Throws:
MetricResultException

toXMLString

public abstract java.lang.String[] toXMLString(int precision)
Returns a string representation of the result for writing to an XML file with a specified writing precision. The results may be spread across several strings to be written as individual nodes.

Parameters:
precision - the writing precision
Returns:
a string representation for writing to XML

getIntervalsFromResults

public abstract java.util.TreeMap<ProbabilityIntervalParameter,MetricResult[]> getIntervalsFromResults(ProbabilityIntervalParameter[] intervals,
                                                                                                       MetricResult[] results,
                                                                                                       double nV,
                                                                                                       int minSampleSize)
                                                                                                throws SamplingIntervalException
Returns a set of sampling intervals for the input results. Throws an exception if the intervals are null or the input results are null, contain no elements or contain null elements, or if any of the input results are not of the same class as the implementing class. Also throws an exception if intervals are repeated. These checks are implemented in the checkIntervalsInput(int, evs.metric.parameters.ProbabilityIntervalParameter[], evs.metric.results.MetricResult[], int). The intervals are computed from the pointwise statistics at the lowest level result type (e.g. the double element of a result of type DoubleResult) and the lower and upper bounds are returned in the same result type as the input, indexed by interval in the returned map. The statistics are computed from the empirical probability distributions of the pointwise results, without any plotting position formula. In other words, given a set of 100 order statistics, the {0.05, 0.95} interval will correspond to the 5th and 95th order statistics, respectively. An exception is thrown if any one of the intervals cannot be computed. Returns the null value identifier for each pointwise statistic in which all of the input results are null or below the non-null results are below the minimum sample size (which must be greater than 0 and less than the size of the input results array).

Parameters:
intervals - an array of sampling intervals to compute from the results
results - an array of results from which to compute sampling intervals
nV - a null value identifier to ignore when computing the intervals
minSampleSize - the minimum sample size from which to return non-null interval identifiers
Returns:
the sampling intervals
Throws:
SamplingIntervalException

hasSamplingIntervals

public boolean hasSamplingIntervals()
Returns true if one or more sampling uncertainty intervals are associated with the metric result, false otherwise.

Returns:
true if one or more sampling uncertainty intervals are available

hasMainInterval

public boolean hasMainInterval()
Returns true if a "main" sampling uncertainty interval has been defined, false otherwise.

Returns:
true if a main interval has been defined, false otherwise

hasAncillaryIntervals

public boolean hasAncillaryIntervals()
Returns true if one or more ancillary intervals are available. An ancillary interval is anything except a main interval.

Returns:
true if an ancillary interval has been defined, false otherwise

getMainInterval

public ProbabilityIntervalParameter getMainInterval()
Returns the main sampling interval associated with the metric result or null if no interval has been defined.

Returns:
the main interval or null

getIntervalResults

public java.util.TreeMap<ProbabilityIntervalParameter,MetricResult[]> getIntervalResults()
Returns the sampling intervals and associated lower and upper bounds in a map, or null if no sampling intervals are available.

Returns:
an array of sampling intervals and associated bounds

getMainIntervalResults

public MetricResult[] getMainIntervalResults()
Returns the main sampling interval results associated with the metric result or null if no interval has been defined. The lower bound is contained in the first index of the array, and the upper bound in the second index.

Returns:
the main interval or null

getAncillaryIntervalResults

public java.util.TreeMap<ProbabilityIntervalParameter,MetricResult[]> getAncillaryIntervalResults()
Returns the sampling intervals and associated lower and upper bounds in a map, or null if no sampling intervals are available. Removes any "main" interval from the map.

Returns:
an array of sampling intervals and associated bounds, minus anu main interval

addSamplingInterval

public void addSamplingInterval(ProbabilityIntervalParameter interval,
                                MetricResult lower,
                                MetricResult upper,
                                MetricResult sampleSize,
                                boolean main)
                         throws SamplingIntervalException
Associates a sampling uncertainty interval with the metric result. The input type must be the same for the lower and upper bound and must be consistent with the main result type determined on construction. If either of these conditions are not met, or if the same interval exists in the local store, an exception is thrown. An interval may be identified as a "main" interval. No sensibility checks are performed on the content of the lower or upper bound (e.g. that the intervals are, in some sense, valid, such as the upper bound being higher than the lower bound); this should be ensured beforehand.

Parameters:
interval - the interval
lower - the lower bound
upper - the upper bound
sampleSize - the sample size data
main - is true to identify the current interval as the main interval, replacing any existing main interval
Throws:
SamplingIntervalException

addSamplingIntervals

public void addSamplingIntervals(java.util.TreeMap<ProbabilityIntervalParameter,MetricResult[]> intervals,
                                 ProbabilityIntervalParameter main)
                          throws SamplingIntervalException
Adds a set of sampling intervals in the input map to the result. In addition, a main interval may be defined. Throws an exception if the main interval is not contained in the input map or under any of the conditions in which addSamplingInterval(evs.metric.parameters.ProbabilityIntervalParameter, evs.metric.results.MetricResult, evs.metric.results.MetricResult, evs.metric.results.MetricResult, boolean) throws an exception.

Parameters:
intervals - the interval results indexed by interval in a map
main - a main interval (may be null)
Throws:
SamplingIntervalException

deepCopyIntervals

protected java.util.TreeMap<ProbabilityIntervalParameter,MetricResult[]> deepCopyIntervals()
Convenience method that returns a deep copy of the sampling uncertainty intervals associated with the result.

Returns:
a deep copy of the sampling uncertainty intervals

checkAggInputs

protected void checkAggInputs(MetricResult[] input,
                              double[] weights)
                       throws MetricResultException
Checks whether the specified inputs are all non-null and of the same class and throws an exception one or both conditions are not met. If the input contains a matrix, the matrix dimensions are also checked for equivalence and an exception thrown if they are not equivalent. Does not check whether the inputs are appropriate for a given implementation of aggregate(evs.metric.results.MetricResult[], evs.utilities.mathutil.VectorFunction, double[]) in a subclass.

Parameters:
input - the input results to check
weights - the weights to check
Throws:
MetricResultException

checkIntervalsInput

protected void checkIntervalsInput(int resultType,
                                   ProbabilityIntervalParameter[] intervals,
                                   MetricResult[] results,
                                   int minSampleSize)
                            throws SamplingIntervalException
Checks the input for calculation of sampling intervals from an array of results as prescribed by getIntervalsFromResults(evs.metric.parameters.ProbabilityIntervalParameter[], evs.metric.results.MetricResult[], double, int). Throws an exception if the intervals are null or the input results are null, contain no elements or contain null elements, or if any of the input results are not of the same class as the implementing class specified by the input result type, which is one of the class variables in this class. Also throws an exception if intervals are repeated or if the minimum sample size is zero or greater than the size of the input result array.

Parameters:
resultType - the result type expected
intervals - the array of intervals to compute
results - from which the intervals will be computed
minSampleSize - the minimum sample size
Throws:
SamplingIntervalException
